Left-click on the crew hatch for the hitchhiker and it should open up a window that allows you to EVA them.

Not sure if it's a problem with your craft or your game. Can you test by making a new craft with nothing but a capsule atop a hitchhiker and try it on the launch pad? If it doesn't work there, then you know it's game related at least.

To reiterate 1001sd's question: Are you on a mac?

If you are on a mac running Snow Leopard or lower, there is a known issue with this. I believe the workaround is to not only be running in windowed mode, but that you actually have to click away from the KSP window (or maybe even put focus on a different program), and then click back onto the ksp window. I have also seen people suggest simply spam-clicking the hatch as a solution. Maybe you have to do both; I'm not really sure. Poke around the forum a little bit. I'm sure there's at least one thread on the topic. Probably several

Their image disappears from the portrait area on all releases. Try having a probe body or manned capsule on the storage container. Also note that the storage container does NOT behave like a command pod at all.
Are you sure there are kerbals inside it?
Yes, I'm running a Mac- I'm not on it right now, so I can't find exactly what version it is, but I'll try your fix and find out.
Yes, I know. It's docked with a space station.

Do you see the "Crew Hatch" popup text before you click? From what I understand the condition is the same, so if you see the popup it should work, and if you don't, the game doesn't think you're mousing over the right spot.
There is a known bug associated with the Hitchhiker. Sometimes Kerbals that you put into it simply disappear.

You're not doing anything wrong; as iamaphazael mentioned, it's a known issue with OS X 10.6 (Snow Leopard), it doesn't happen in 10.7 or 10.8. The bug report might not be public anymore due to some new categorisations on the bug tracker, but it's still filed.

It can be worked-around by clicking on another window/application, then the next click on the KSP window / hatch will work, but you must leave fullscreen to do this. If your machine meets the requirements for OS X 10.8 (Mountain Lion), the upgrade is worth it, the only downsides are that spaces must be in a line rather than a grid and it doesn't have the ability to emulate PPC binaries like 10.6 does.
Oh, brilliant! Clicking out of the window works. Thanks!
